pageContext.claim: “We're taking in billions of dollars from China. We never took in 10 cents from China. They took everything from us; we never took anything from them. Now, as of already, we're taking in -- right now, we're taking in billions. China is -- people don't understand this: China is right now paying us -- right now, paying us billions of dollars a month. That's never happened before.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump is referring to tariffs, but this isn't how they work. The cost of tariffs is usually passed on to consumers; in this case, U.S. consumers. Furthermore, he exaggerates the trade history. The U.S. imports much more from China than it exports to the country. But China nevertheless is the third-largest export market for U.S. companies.
